sections.purpose: To extinguish small fires in the Pharmacognosy laboratory involving flammable solvents, electrical equipment, or plant materials.
sections.scope: Applicable to emergency fire response in the Pharmacognosy department.
procedure: Identify the fire type (A: ordinary combustibles, B: flammable liquids, C: electrical, D: metals).
Select the appropriate extinguisher for the fire class.
Pull the safety pin, aiming the nozzle at the base of the fire.
Squeeze the handle to discharge while sweeping side to side.
Back away while continuing to apply the agent until the fire is extinguished.
Evacuate if the fire cannot be controlled and call emergency services.
Report the incident and have the extinguisher refilled by authorized personnel.
precautions: Never use water on electrical or flammable liquid fires.
Know the location of all extinguishers and emergency exits.
Evacuate first if the fire is large or spreading.
Do not re-enter the area until declared safe by authorities.
Inspect monthly and after each use.
